item.title: 梅西百货上调年度预期，扭亏为盈初见成效
item.description: 梅西百货公司（Macy's）周三上调了年度销售额和利润预期，这得益于包括布鲁明戴尔百货公司（Bloomingdale's）和蓝水星连锁店（Bluemercury）在内的各品牌需求的恢复，该零售商的扭亏为盈计划正在成形。【原文：Macy's raised its annual sales and profit forecasts on Wednesday, helped by resilient demand across banners including Bloomingdale's and Bluemercury chains as the retailer's turnaround plan takes shape.】

item.title: 早间竞标美国长期债券收益率再次测试 5
item.description: 当今美国和全球市场的重要事件【原文：What matters in U.S. and global markets today】

item.title: 美联储降息和对独立性的怀疑使美元持续承压：路透调查
item.description: 路透社周三对外汇策略师进行的一项调查显示，由于市场参与者在思考美联储未来的独立性以及美联储可能还会进行多少次降息，未来几个月美元将走软。【原文：The U.S. dollar will weaken over coming months as market participants ponder the Federal Reserve's future independence and how many more rate cuts it may deliver, a Reuters survey of foreign exchange strategists showed on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美元树公司上调年度目标，因廉价商品需求强劲
item.description: Dollar Tree 周三上调了年度销售额和利润预期，原因是越来越多不同收入类别的美国人在其门店购买更便宜的食品杂货、服装和家居装饰用品。【原文：Dollar Tree raised its annual sales and profit forecasts on Wednesday as more Americans across income categories shop for cheaper groceries, apparel and home decor items at its stores.】

item.title: 公交技术公司 Via Transportation 在美国 IPO 的目标估值高达 35 亿美元
item.description: 公交技术制造商 Via Transportation 公司周三表示，其首次公开募股的目标估值高达 35 亿美元，加入了今年秋季在美国交易所上市的公司行列。【原文：Transit technology maker Via Transportation said on Wednesday it was targeting a valuation of up to $3.50 billion in its initial public offering, joining a wave of companies aiming to list their shares on U.S. exchanges this fall.】

item.title: 海王保险申请在美国上市，IPO窗口重新开启
item.description: 洪水保险供应商海王星公司周三提交了美国首次公开募股申请，成为利用投资者对新股的新需求的最新一家公司。【原文：Flood insurance provider Neptune filed for a U.S. initial public offering on Wednesday, becoming the latest company to tap into renewed investor demand for new stocks.】

item.title: 美国法官将听取对允许波音公司避免因坠机事件被起诉的协议的反对意见
item.description: 周三，一名美国法官将就是否批准司法部与波音公司达成的一项协议举行听证会，该协议允许波音公司避免因两起造成 346 人死亡的 737 MAX 飞机坠毁事故而被起诉。【原文：A U.S. judge on Wednesday will hold a hearing on whether to approve a deal between the Justice Department and Boeing that allows the planemaker to avoid prosecution on a charge stemming from two fatal 737 MAX plane crashes that killed 346 people.】

item.title: 谷歌的人工智能竞争对手从数据共享令中获益，但科技巨头远未溃败
item.description: 本周二的一项反垄断裁决命令 Alphabet 旗下的谷歌公司与竞争对手共享其宝贵的搜索数据，这将使一批新兴的人工智能公司从中获益。【原文：A rising group of artificial intelligence companies stand to gain from an antitrust ruling on Tuesday that ordered Alphabet's Google to share its invaluable search data with competitors.】

item.title: 特朗普将请求最高法院挽救关税，但面临棘手的法律问题
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）在下级法院两次受挫后，即将要求保守派占多数的最高法院确认其广泛的紧急关税措施有效，但他的政府在推进后备计划时将面临棘手的法律问题。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump is set to imminently ask the conservative-majority Supreme Court to validate his broad emergency tariffs after two setbacks at lower courts, but will face tough legal questions as his administration presses ahead with backup plans.】

item.title: 美元匮乏，委内瑞拉货币交易所转向加密货币
item.description: 十几位消息人士称，由于美国对石油出口的限制减少了可用的外汇，委内瑞拉政府正在慢慢允许私营部门在货币兑换中使用与美元挂钩的加密货币。【原文：Venezuela's government is slowly allowing the use of dollar-tied cryptocurrencies in currency exchanges for the private sector, a dozen sources said, as U.S. restrictions on oil exports reduce available foreign currency.】

item.title: 边疆航空公司高管称，该公司的新福利以竞争对手的忠诚会员为目标
item.description: 据超低成本航空公司边疆航空公司（Frontier Airlines）的一位高层管理人员称，该公司正试图通过提供新的旅行奖励措施来吸引其他航空公司的高端乘客，因为他们可能会对目前的忠诚度福利感到不满。【原文：Frontier Airlines is seeking to lure premium flyers of other airlines, who may feel dissatisfied with their current loyalty perks, by offering new travel incentives, according to a top executive of the ultra-low-cost carrier.】

item.title: 独家报道文件显示，美国交易公司简街对印度市场监管机构提起诉讼
item.description: 根据路透社查阅的一份案件文件，简街公司周三对印度市场监管机构提起诉讼，指控这家美国高频交易巨头操纵市场。【原文：Jane Street on Wednesday filed a case against India's markets regulator which has accused the U.S. high-frequency trading giant of market manipulation, according to a case document reviewed by Reuters.】

item.title: Zalando 将对欧盟法院驳回其挑战欧盟技术规则的裁决提起上诉
item.description: 欧洲最大的在线零售公司 Zalando 周三表示，将对欧盟法院驳回其对具有里程碑意义的欧盟技术规则的挑战的裁决提起上诉。【原文：Zalando will appeal an EU court ruling dismissing its challenge against landmark EU tech rules, Europe's biggest online retail company said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 标准普尔 500 指数和纳斯达克指数期货在 Alphabet 反垄断裁决后上涨；就业数据即将公布
item.description: 与 S&P 500 指数和纳斯达克指数挂钩的期货周三反弹，Alphabet 领涨部分大型股，而道指期货在当天晚些时候公布劳动力市场数据前走低。【原文：Futures tied to the S&P 500 and the Nasdaq rebounded on Wednesday with Alphabet leading gains in some megacap stocks, while Dow futures edged lower ahead of labor market data due to be released later in the day.】

item.title: 阿提哈德航空上半年利润创历史最佳，得益于全球扩张和乘客增长
item.description: 阿布扎比阿提哈德航空公司（Etihad Airways）周三表示，该公司上半年的净利润达到 11.2 亿阿联酋迪拉姆（约合 3.0496 亿美元），同比增长 32%，是迄今为止盈利能力最强的半年。【原文：Abu Dhabi's Etihad Airways first half was its most profitable yet, the company said Wednesday, as its net profit reached 1.12 billion UAE dirham ($304.96 million), up 32% year-on-year.】

item.title: 财政担忧挥之不去，长期债券收益率持续攀升
item.description: 由于对全球财政健康状况的担忧加剧，周三全球长期政府借贷成本继续走高，日本突破历史高点，英国和德国升至多年新高。【原文：Global long-dated government borrowing costs continued their march higher on Wednesday, breaching record highs in Japan and rising to fresh multi-year peaks in Britain and Germany as concerns mounted over global fiscal health.】

item.title: 消息人士称欧佩克+将于周日考虑进一步提高石油产量
item.description: 两位熟悉讨论情况的消息人士称，欧佩克+将在周日的会议上考虑进一步提高石油产量，因为该组织正努力重新夺回市场份额。【原文：OPEC+ will consider further raising oil production at a meeting on Sunday, two sources familiar with the discussions said, as the group seeks to regain market share.】

item.title: 从硬币到矿工：特朗普家族的加密货币游戏规则
item.description: 与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的儿子们旗下的一家加密货币企业有关的代币 $WLFI 首次上市交易，让人们看到了特朗普家族在加密货币领域不断增长的足迹。【原文：The trading debut of $WLFI, a token linked to a cryptocurrency venture affiliated with U.S. President Donald Trump's sons, has cast a spotlight on the family's growing footprint in the space.】

item.title: 荷兰养老基金 PFZW 因在可持续发展问题上发生冲突而终止与贝莱德的合作
item.description: 荷兰养老基金 PFZW 周三表示，该基金已结束与财富管理公司贝莱德（BlackRock）的合作关系，对其投资组合进行了全面调整，旨在优先考虑可持续投资。【原文：Dutch pension fund PFZW has ended its relationship with wealth manager BlackRock in an overhaul of its investment portfolio aimed at prioritising sustainable investments, it said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国法院裁决缓解反垄断担忧，Alphabet 股价大涨
item.description: 谷歌母公司 Alphabet 周三在盘前交易中大涨 6%，此前美国联邦法官在一宗反垄断案中免除了该公司被强制解散的命运，这标志着这家在搜索和移动生态系统中占据主导地位的科技巨头迎来了一个关键时刻，而该公司在搜索和移动生态系统中的主导地位长期以来一直备受关注。【原文：Google-parent Alphabet surged 6% in premarket trading on Wednesday after a U.S. federal judge spared the company from a forced breakup in an antitrust case, marking a pivotal moment for the tech giant whose dominance in search and mobile ecosystems has long drawn scrutiny.】

item.title: 欧盟起草防止规避碳边境关税的计划
item.description: 欧盟委员会发言人表示，欧盟委员会将在今年提出措施，防止各国规避碳边境关税，因为布鲁塞尔的一些人担心中国企业可能会重新调整贸易以规避征税。【原文：The European Commission will propose measures this year to prevent countries from dodging its carbon border tariff, a Commission spokesperson said, as some in Brussels fear Chinese firms could reshuffle their trade to avoid the levy.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行行长：探索人工智能如何影响经济
item.description: 澳大利亚央行行长周三表示，澳大利亚央行正在探索人工智能等新兴技术如何影响经济，并可能对通胀和劳动力市场产生影响。【原文：Australia's central bank is exploring how emerging technologies like artificial intelligence could influence the economy, with possible implications for inflation and the labour market, its governor said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 欧元区 8 月份采购经理人指数显示经济增长依然疲软
item.description: 周三的一项调查显示，尽管新订单总量自去年 5 月以来首次出现增长，但由于服务业增长疲软抵消了制造业产出的增长，欧元区 8 月份的经济仍以蜗牛般的速度扩张。【原文：The euro zone economy kept expanding at a snail's pace in August as weaker services growth offset improved manufacturing output, despite the first rise in overall new orders since May last year, a survey showed on Wednesday.】

item.title: iBASIS 将收购澳大利亚 Telstra 集团的资产
item.description: 美国通信解决方案提供商 iBASIS 公司周三表示，该公司已与澳大利亚 Telstra 集团签署协议，收购 Telstra 国际公司的语音、移动和信息客户批发合同。【原文：U.S. communications solutions provider iBASIS has signed a deal with Australia's Telstra Group to acquire wholesale voice, mobile, and messaging customer contracts from Telstra International, it said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 欧盟法院支持欧盟与美国的最新数据传输协议
item.description: 欧洲第二最高法院周三支持欧盟与美国两年前达成的一项新的数据传输协议，以取代之前被上一级法庭驳回的两项协议。【原文：Europe's second-highest court on Wednesday backed a new data transfer deal agreed between the European Union and the United States two years ago to replace two previous pacts rejected by a higher tribunal.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长拉加德：欧盟应弥补稳定币规则的漏洞
item.description: 欧洲中央银行行长克里斯蒂娜-拉加德（Christine Lagarde）周三表示，欧盟立法者应要求外国稳定币发行商提供 "保障措施 "和 "健全的等效制度"，以防止欧盟持有的储备出现挤兑风险。【原文：European Union legislators should demand "safeguards" and "robust equivalence regimes" from foreign issuers of stablecoins to prevent the risk of runs on reserves held in the EU, European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 欧盟法院称，根据欧盟规则，Zalando 可被称为大型在线平台
item.description: 欧洲第二最高法院周三表示，根据欧盟网络内容规则，德国在线时尚零售商 Zalando 可被认定为超大型网络平台，支持欧盟技术监管机构的观点。【原文：Europe's second-highest court on Wednesday said German online fashion retailer Zalando can be labeled as a very large online platform under EU online content rules, siding with EU tech regulators.】

item.title: 丰田将在捷克工厂生产欧洲首款全电动汽车
item.description: 丰田公司周三表示，将在捷克共和国的工厂生产一款电动汽车车型，这将是丰田在欧洲生产的首款全电动车型，丰田还将在该工厂投资新建一座电池组装厂。【原文：Toyota said on Wednesday it would build an electric vehicle model at its factory in the Czech Republic, its first fully-electric model to be made in Europe, and would also invest in a new battery assembly facility at the plant.】

item.title: 瑞士钟表预计上半年不会受到美国关税的影响
item.description: 瑞士手表公司（Watches of Switzerland）周三表示，该公司有望公布符合预期的上半年业绩，并补充说，这家奢侈手表零售商预计在此期间不会受到美国关税的任何实质性影响。【原文：Watches of Switzerland said on Wednesday that it was on track to report first-half results in line with its expectations, adding that the luxury watch retailer does not anticipate any material impact from U.S. tariffs in that period.】

item.title: 三得利前首席执行官称他相信自己购买了合法保健品
item.description: 日本最知名的商界领袖之一新波武史（Takeshi Niinami）因购买保健品而受到警方调查，他在周三表示，他相信这些产品是合法的。【原文：Takeshi Niinami, one of Japan's best-known business leaders who is the subject of a police investigation into his purchases of supplements, said on Wednesday that he believed that the products were legal.】
